title: Lady Gaga stuns with high-flying Super Bowl halftime show -

Photo: Michael Ciaglo, Houston Chronicle Image 52 of 52 Lady Gaga stuns with high-flying Super Bowl halftime show 1 / 52 Back to Gallery There was talk for weeks leading up to Lady Gaga's Super Bowl LI halftime performance about what she would or would not say.
Lady Gaga Super Bowl LI setlist Poker Face Born This Way Telephone Just Dance Million Reasons Bad Romance Would she get political? Would she address immigration? Would she take a swipe at the president?
Turns out her most important message was a personal one.
I'M HERE FOR THE ADS: Watch the rest of the controversial 84 Lumber Super Bowl immigration ad here
"Hi dad. Hi mom," she said amid the piano strains of "Million Reasons." It was a welcome, intimate moment amid so much spectacle.
This is Gaga's second Super Bowl in a row. She performed the National Anthem during last year's game.
As rumored, she indeed started on the roof of NRG Stadium, the city of Houston providing a gorgeous backdrop. And she did use music to promote messages of inclusion and equality, moving from "God Bless America" to "This Land is Your Land" and a snippet of the Pledge of Allegiance during her rooftop serenade.
PHOTOS: Super Bowl 51 hits Houston's NRG Stadium
From there, it was pure over-the-top party. She flew through the air on a wire and onto the peak of the stage for "Poker Face."
She flipped and twirled and kicked in the air as a throng of dancers and fans waited below on a huge stage flanked by LED star frameworks. There was pyro and glowsticks and so many paws way, way up.
A crew of 400 locals helped assemble the stage just before Gaga appeared.
TRUMP VS. OBAMA: How the president celebrated his first Super Bowl
"It's been amazing to be part of this experience. It's like nothing I've ever been a part of," said longtime little monster Shaye Ervin earlier in the day."I'm so excited."
Gaga stuck mostly to her biggest hits, including "Just Dance" and a feverish "Bad Romance." It was a move designed to appeal to football fans who may not know her newer material from the "Joanne" album.
She sounded great and looked every bit the pop superstar in a sparkling bodysuit and shoulder pads.
CRASH PAD: Lady Gaga landed cool place to stay in Houston
There were no surprises guests, despite the inclusion of Beyonc√© duet "Telephone." (It could have made for a perfect Houston moment.)
Earlier in the week, she dedicated the 13-minute performance to her fans, to "that kid that couldn't get a seat at the cool kids table and that kid that was kicked out of the house because his mom and dad didn't accept him for who he was."
It was a message most apparent during equality anthem "Born This Way." And it indeed seemed like a small act of revolution to sing the line "Don't be a drag, just be a queen" in front of so much testosterone-fueled energy.
